Detailed Description

template<typename NODE, class BACKOFF = backoff::empty, class ALLOCATOR = CDS_DEFAULT_ALIGNED_ALLOCATOR>
class cds::gc::tagged::FreeList< NODE, BACKOFF, ALLOCATOR >

FreeList of Tagged pointer reclamation schema.

FreeList is list of free nodes. To prevent ABA-problem tagged reclamation schema implies that the node is never freed physically. Instead of deallocation the node is placed in special container named free-list. So free-list may be considered as an allocator for data of type NODE. The implementation of free-list is canonical stack.

Template parameters:
  • NODE - type of node
  • BACKOFF - back-off cshema. The default is backoff::empty
  • ALLOCATOR - aligned memory allocator. The default class is defined by CDS_DEFAULT_ALIGNED_ALLOCATOR macro
The main problem of tagged reclamation schema is destroying a node. The node of tagged containers is the structure like this: 
            template <typename T>
            struct Node: public cds::gc::tagged::ContainerNode
            {
                tagged_type< Node<T>* >     m_next    ;
                T                        m_data    ;
            }
cds::gc::tagged::ContainerNode provides linking unused items to free-list.

When the node is excluding from container it must be placed into appropriate free-list. However, on the destroying time the destructor of type NODE must not be called because of the access to deleted node can be possible (the free-list must be a type-stable container). So the destructor NODE::~NODE of data may be safely called in FreeList::pop method before returning the node cached in free-list. This is achieved by calling destroy_data member function of type NODE. See ContainerNode class for further explanation of NODE requirements.

Member Function Documentation

template<typename NODE , class BACKOFF = backoff::empty, class ALLOCATOR = CDS_DEFAULT_ALIGNED_ALLOCATOR>
node_type* cds::gc::tagged::FreeList< NODE, BACKOFF, ALLOCATOR >::pop (  ) [inline, private]

Pops cached node from internal stack. If free-list is not empty this method calls destroy_data of popped node before return.
